item.title: Welcome to my Knowledgebase
item.description: Hey there! üëã This is my personal knowledge base, where I document my journey, notes, and learnings in the world of computer science. Here you can explore my write-ups, dive into concepts, and just learn alongside me.

item.title: Hash
item.description: A hash value is a numeric value of a fixed length that uniquely identifies data. It is the result of a hashing algorithm. Common Hash Types MD5 (Message Digest, defined by RFC 1321 MD5 is a widely used cryptographic hash function with a 128-bit hash value.

item.title: Masquerading
item.description: Masquerading occurs when the name or location of an object, legitimate or malicious, is manipulated or abused for the sake of evading defenses and observation ...

item.title: Network Propagation
item.description: After a device is exploited in a network, the adversary spreads its access through the network. Exploiting more devices in the same network becomes a lot more easier because usually: Credentials to other devices may be insecurely stored on host Host might have exclusive access to other devices such as printers and storages, not open to public Hence, the attacker would set up a base on one of the systems to act as their pivot point and use it to gather information about the internal network.

item.title: OSINT
item.description: Open source intelligence (OSINT) is the act of gathering and analyzing publicly available data for intelligence purposes.

item.title: Pass the Hash Attack
item.description: A Pass-the-Hash (PtH) attack is a technique where an attacker captures a password Hash (as opposed to the password characters) and then passes it through for authentication and lateral ...

item.title: Phishing
item.description: Phishing is a form of social engineering and a scam where attackers deceive people into revealing sensitive information or installing malware such as viruses, worms, adware, or ...

item.title: Pyramid of Pain
item.description: Pyramid of Pain is a conceptual model which organizes IOCs(Indicators Of Compromise) with the level of difficulty it will cause for an adversary to change the indicators associated ...

item.title: Reconnaissance
item.description: Reconnaissance (MITRE Tactic TA0043) is discovering and collecting information on the system and the victim. The reconnaissance phase is the planning phase for the adversaries.
